alert.note: Alert for East Turnagain Arm (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued November 07 at 4:06PM AKST until November 08 at 11:00PM AKST by NWS Anchorage
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH IN EFFECT FROM WEDNESDAY MORNING THROUGH THURSDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by rain and snowmelt is possible. * WHERE...East Turnagain Arm. This includes the cities of Girdwood And Portage. * WHEN...From Wednesday morning through Thursday evening. * IMPACTS...Rain Wednesday morning will become heavy at times with the heaviest rainfall rates expected Wednesday afternoon through Thursday. 2.0" to 3.0" of rain is likely with this system. Rain on top of any snowpack and frozen ground will lead to ponding of water on area of roadways. Excessive runoff may result in flooding of low-lying and flood-prone locations. Flooding may occur in poor drainage and urban areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Heavy rain may fall on the existing snowpack leading to increased runoff. Flows in rivers may increase quickly and reach impactful levels. - Http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood - Storm drains should be kept clear of debris as much as possible.
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop. Stay tuned to further developments on weather.gov/Anchorage or by listening to your local radio, television, or NOAA Weather Radio for further information.
